content:
Diagnosis:	Basal cell carcinoma right temple, T2 with local invasion

Management:	12 Jan 2024 Diagnostic biopsy
		15 Feb 2024 Commenced radiotherapy

Histology:	Nodular basal cell carcinoma with infiltrative features

Current situation:	Week 4 of radiotherapy treatment

[redacted name] attended for week 4 review of superficial radiotherapy to right temple lesion. Treatment has been well tolerated with expected grade 1 radiation dermatitis. The lesion shows good response with reduction in size and induration. No concerning symptoms reported. Examination shows brisk erythema of treatment field with appropriate moist desquamation centrally. Treatment field margins appear adequate. Patient understands to continue with regular moisturizer and sun protection. Will complete planned course of 45Gy in 10 fractions next week. Follow-up arranged in 6 weeks to assess treatment response.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: nodular basal cell carcinoma with infiltrative features

cancer_timeline.value: Started superficial radiotherapy, planned 45Gy in 10 fractions
Week 4 of radiotherapy with good response, reduction in lesion size

patient_facts.value: brisk erythema of treatment field with appropriate moist desquamation centrally

status_updates.value: T2 basal cell carcinoma right temple undergoing radiotherapy with good early response
reduction in size and induration of lesion
continuing with planned radiotherapy course of 45Gy in 10 fractions
follow-up arranged in 6 weeks to assess treatment response
